title: Sustainable Supply Chain Strategy
overview: Companies bear increasing responsibility for supply chain sustainability. The approach involves mapping current state, identifying opportunities, mitigating risks, and designing future state with actionable roadmaps. According to the ISCEA definition: 'orchestrating and continuously improving planning and execution of processes along an end-to-end value chain to achieve efficient resource use while minimizing waste.' Key requirement: Strong alignment between corporate strategy and supply chain strategy with clear priority understanding.

solutions.title: Understand Company Strategy & Define Priorities - BASIC
solutions.description: Establish alignment between corporate ESG material topics and supply chain strategy. Conduct materiality assessments to prioritize environmental, social, and governance issues affecting business success and stakeholder interests. Identify SDGs with greatest impact and determine supply chain levers across procurement, manufacturing, logistics, and distribution.

solutions.title: Implement Supplier Code of Conduct - BASIC
solutions.description: Create foundational supplier code of conduct establishing shared principles and values. This attracts aligned suppliers, provides clarity on value mismatches, protects against risks, and fosters transparent communication. Must cover labor, environment, and ethics minimum requirements.

solutions.title: Assess Sustainability Baseline of Existing Supply Chain - INTERMEDIATE
solutions.description: Evaluate current environmental and social impacts across end-to-end supply chain.

details: Identify key suppliers, manufacturers, distributors, customers
Determine geographic locations and product lines
Create visual supply chain representation showing material flow and impact connections
Select KPIs aligned with sustainability goals
Reference 'Common Set of Core ESG Metrics from SGX' adapted to business scope
Track carbon emissions, energy use, water consumption, waste generation, social responsibility, ethical sourcing
Collect information through surveys, interviews, data sharing agreements
Leverage technology and software solutions for streamlined collection and accuracy
Evaluate full supply chain environmental footprint
Use life cycle assessment (LCA) on representative products
Examine labor conditions, human rights, ethical sourcing

solutions.title: Map Supply Chain Risks & Develop Mitigation Plans - INTERMEDIATE
solutions.description: Create structured risk management framework assessing supply chain vulnerabilities to current and future climate conditions. Establish transparency before risk assessment.
required_components: Risk analysis: Hazard identification, exposure levels, associated risks
Risk assessment: Acceptable risk thresholds, current response mechanisms
Risk mitigation plan: Avoidance, reduction, transfer, or acceptance strategies
solutions.note: High probability/high severity risks require frequent monitoring and inform future state planning.

solutions.title: Establish Future State of Supply Chain - ADVANCED
solutions.description: Redesign supply chain achieving step-change sustainability results balancing cost, responsiveness, and resilience.

implementation_steps.description: Gather business needs, sustainability objectives, risk mitigation requirements

requirements: Manufacturing facility location near consumption areas with renewable energy access
Supplier proximity prioritizing high social performance
Information systems enabling traceability and transparency

implementation_steps.description: Document future state of supply chain
Establish transition plan with financial implications and resource allocation

solutions.note: Multi-year complex journey potentially requiring supplier confirmation and new supplier introduction.

solutions.title: Control & Measure End-to-End Supply Chain Performance - ADVANCED
solutions.description: Implement continuous improvement methods (Plan/Do/Check/Act) monitoring, controlling, and adjusting plans over time. Requires structured approach leveraging ERP systems or cloud-based ESG solutions. External connectivity critical for monitoring internal and external supply chain components. Reporting platform integration with ESG databases (e.g., GHG emissions factor databases) enables transparency for company and supplier base. Cross-supply chain collaboration captures joint targets and action plans.
common_kpis: Percentage of suppliers endorsing Supplier Code of Conduct
Percentage of procurement team receiving sustainable procurement training
Percentage of suppliers with ESG risk assessments conducted
Percentage of suppliers with ESG contract clauses
Percentage of new suppliers screened using ESG criteria
Percentage of suppliers assessed via EcoVadis or questionnaires
Percentage of suppliers audited on human rights/ESG topics
Percentage of high-risk suppliers with established ESG action plans
